messages.content: Yes, my fiancé is going crazy. I think he's going to try to kill himself. I need an ambulance; they're going to have to restrain him.
Is he hurting anyone else, or just himself?
He's not hurting anyone else, but he's screaming that he hates himself and he wants to die, and he's hitting himself in the head.
All right, one second. How long has he been drinking?
Is he aware of you calling?
What's the cell phone number you're calling from in case we get disconnected?
Where is he now in the house?
In the downstairs with my roommate and one of his friends.
Are they just keeping an eye on him?
One of them is holding him, trying to keep him from hitting himself.
So you have at least one person trying to restrain him?
Is he completely awake right now?
Can I go down there to check on him?
Yes, but stay on the phone with me. If you need to put the phone down, that's okay.
Are there any weapons present in the house?
Okay, I'm going to keep you on the phone until the officers get there due to the seriousness of the situation. Are your friends aware that you're calling?
Yes, but I really need to get down there.
Go ahead and walk down there. I'll stay on the phone with you. Protect him from himself, but protect yourself first.
Hey, look at me. Look at me.
We've got police on the way; they'll be there first to assist.
We do have crisis intervention officers; one of them will be arriving.
Can you unlock the front door and make sure they can get in?
